t: Isaiah 42
The Servant of the Lord
“Here*pn is my servant, whom I uphold, my*ld chosen one in whom I delight; I*ln will put my Spirit on him, and*ld he will bring justice to the nations.
He*ln will not shout or cry out, or*ld raise his voice in the streets.
A*ln bruised reed he will not break, and*ld a smoldering wick he will not snuff out. In*ln faithfulness he will bring forth justice;
he*ld will not falter or be discouraged till*ln he establishes justice on earth. In*ld his teaching the islands will put their hope.”

This*pn is what God the Lord*s says— the*ln Creator of the heavens, who stretches them out, who*ld spreads out the earth with all that springs from it, who*ld gives breath to its people, and*ld life to those who walk on it:
“I,*ln the Lord,*s have called you in righteousness; I*ld will take hold of your hand. I*ln will keep you and will make you to*ld be a covenant for the people and*ld a light for the Gentiles,
to*ln open eyes that are blind, to*ld free captives from prison and*ld to release from the dungeon those who sit in darkness.
“I*pn am the Lord;*s that is my name! I*ld will not yield my glory to another or*ld my praise to idols.
See,*ln the former things have taken place, and*ld new things I declare; before*ln they spring into being I*ld announce them to you.”
Song of Praise to the Lord
Sing*pn to the Lord*s a new song, his*ld praise from the ends of the earth, you*ln who go down to the sea, and all that is in it, you*ld islands, and all who live in them.
Let*ln the wilderness and its towns raise their voices; let*ld the settlements where Kedar lives rejoice. Let*ln the people of Sela sing for joy; let*ld them shout from the mountaintops.
Let*ln them give glory to the Lord*s and*ld proclaim his praise in the islands.
The*ln Lord*s will march out like a champion, like*ld a warrior he will stir up his zeal; with*ln a shout he will raise the battle cry and*ld will triumph over his enemies.
“For*pn a long time I have kept silent, I*ld have been quiet and held myself back. But*ln now, like a woman in childbirth, I*ld cry out, I gasp and pant.
I*ln will lay waste the mountains and hills and*ld dry up all their vegetation; I*ln will turn rivers into islands and*ld dry up the pools.

I*ln will lead the blind by ways they have not known, along*ld unfamiliar paths I will guide them; I*ln will turn the darkness into light before them and*ld make the rough places smooth. These*ln are the things I will do; I*ld will not forsake them.
But*ln those who trust in idols, who*ld say to images, ‘You are our gods,’ will*ld be turned back in utter shame.
Israel Blind and Deaf
“Hear,*pn you deaf; look,*ld you blind, and see!
Who*ln is blind but my servant, and*ld deaf like the messenger I send? Who*ln is blind like the one in covenant with me, blind*ld like the servant of the Lord?*s
You*ln have seen many things, but you pay no attention; your*ld ears are open, but you do not listen.”
It*ln pleased the Lord*s for*ld the sake of his righteousness to*ld make his law great and glorious.

But*ln this is a people plundered and looted, all*ld of them trapped in pits or*ld hidden away in prisons. They*ln have become plunder, with*ld no one to rescue them; they*ln have been made loot, with*ld no one to say, “Send them back.”
Which*pn of you will listen to this or*ld pay close attention in time to come?

Who*ln handed Jacob over to become loot, and*ld Israel to the plunderers? Was*ln it not the Lord,*s against*ld whom we have sinned? For*ln they would not follow his ways; they*ld did not obey his law.
So*ln he poured out on them his burning anger, the*ld violence of war. It*ln enveloped them in flames, yet they did not understand; it*ld consumed them, but they did not take it to heart.
